More than a score of years have passed into eternity with their burden of record since these men became soldiers of the cross; but their experience in the early 
                                                                           17
history of the cause of God has never grown dim.  As their thoughts linger about the past, the fires of love and faith kindle anew in their hearts.  They can say with John, "That which was from the beginning, which we have heard, which we have seen with our eyes, which we have looked upon, and our hands have handled, of the Word of life; ... that which we have seen and heard declare we unto you, that ye also may have fellowship with us."
